intro: Podosemum × angustatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf podosemum, is a hybrid plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are often arranged in opposite pairs along the stem. The flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically producing white or pale pink petals. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is native to parts of Southeast Asia. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
